newsitem.title: UK: Pakistan says plans 10 billion yen Samurai bond.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan says plans 10 billion yen Samurai bond.

text.p: Pakistan plans to launch a Samurai bond of around 10 billion yen ($80.2 million) with a three- to five-year maturity, a Pakistan ministry of finance official said on Thursday.
"Early next year we hope to launch a Samurai bond," Javed Ahmed Noel said.

"We have plans to issue bonds in other currencies and for about seven or eight months we have been thinking of going into the Samurai market and three or four Japanese houses have shown interest in that," he said.
Noel said the bond would be for around 10 billion yen and have a maturity of between three and five years.
He was in London to meet with investors in preparation for the launch of a three-year dollar floating rate note for Pakistan, expected to be launched on May 20.
Noel said Daiwa, Nikko and Nomura among other Japanese houses had shown interest in underwriting the Samurai, the proceeds of which would be used to repay outstanding yen debt.
